overview:
Jason Illoulian is a venture capitalist who founded the investment firm, Faring Capital, in 2009 after earning a bachelor’s degree in International Economics from Georgetown University, a master’s degree in Real Estate and Urban Development from Harvard University, and a law degree from Emory University.

His mission is to seek great talent with whom he can partner, invest, and grow exciting new ideas and businesses in education, technology, and real estate. His legal and urban planning training gave him the tools needed to develop innovative and transformative developments. Jason has wanted to be an entrepreneur since attending Harvard-Westlake, naming Faring after the street where the school was located.

firm.name: U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development Office of Counsel
